The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
Education Code Section 76361 and Title V Section 58520 states that governing board of a community college district may require students in attendance at a campus of the district to pay a fee for purposes of partially or fully recovering transportation costs incurred by the district upon the favorable vote of a majority of the students at a campus of the district who voted at an election on the question of whether or not the governing board should require all students to pay a fee for transportation services.
	 
The Associated Student Government is requesting that the Board of Trustees adopt and publish the attached procedures and to call for an election providing students the opportunity to vote on the following question:
	 
"Should the San Jose Evergreen Community College District Board of Trustees require that all students have access to an ECO PASS and be assessed a mandatory transportation fee of up to $1.66 per semester unit up to a maximum of $20 per semester for purposes of partially or fully recovering transportation costs incurred by the District for transportation services provided by the Valley Transportation Authority (VTA) pursuant to California Education Code Section 76361 and Title V Section 58520?"
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt and publish procedures and call for an election providing students the opportunity to vote on the question of whether or not the Board of Trustees should require all students to pay a fee for transportation services.

items.item_details:
On March 12, 2013 the Board reviewed an information item that presented a summary of  board development  and training options resulting from a Board Study Session conducted on  February 12, 2013. The goal of that session was to review model practices and standards for “effective trusteeship” with a special emphasis on the importance of speaking “with one voice”. The session reviewed guidelines about the governance role of the board as policy makers differentiated from the administrative and managerial role of the Chancellor in the implementation of board policy. Review sessions and discussion centered on six different areas as follows:
	 
• Board Vision/Mission/Goals
• Effective Governance Processes: The Carver Governance Model
• Current Board Structure: Committees and Task Forces
• Board Self Evaluation and Workplan Development
• Board Skills Development Program
• Board Master Calendar
	 
This item presents the SJECCD Board Training and Development Schedule, including priorities and program implementation resources.

items.item_details:
On May 22, 2012 the San Jose / Evergreen Community College District (“District”) Board of Trustees received a presentation regarding the potential for ground leasing and development of the District-owned 27.1 acre property adjacent to Evergreen Valley College.  A Board of Trustees sub-committee on land development was appointed at this meeting to review and evaluate previously approved development principles, identify strategies to address the land use entitlement issue, and coordinate the District’s property disposition and development process with the District Office and Police Academy facility processes.  
	 
The Land Development Sub-committee has met with District staff and District’s consultants on several occasions, and reviewed a substantial amount of technical information related to the issue.  The attached memorandum presents the Land Development Sub-committee’s recommendation to the District Board of Trustees regarding approval of a Request for Proposals (RFP) for disposition and development of the District-owned property for the purpose of generating an ongoing source of revenue to the District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Request for Proposal (RFP) document for development of the District-owned 27.1 acre property adjacent to Evergreen Valley College.

Faculty Association, AFT 6157 Reopener Proposal Expires June 30, 2013
April 9, 2013
	 
The following represents the opening proposal from the Faculty Association, AFT 6157 (Union) to the District. The Union reserves the right to add, amend, delete or change any of these proposals.
	 
Article 8 FULL-TIME FACULTY, HIRE DATES AND SENIORITY
	 
8.1 SALARY SCHEDULE INCREASE
1. Increase all faculty salary columns and steps to at least the median of the Bay 10 plus 1 effective July 1, 2013
2. Salary increase for all faculty of COLA and Growth or 3.6% whichever is higher.
	           
8.2.2 Intersession and summer pro rata salary schedules for full time faculty for the first 40% load for lecture and lab shall be included as Appendix D-3 and D-4 and Work Experience, Directed Studies and Non-Instructional included in Appendix D-5.
	 
ARTICLE 9 ADJUNCT FACULTY AND SUBSTITUTES
	 
9.1 SALARY SCHEDULE INCREASE
1. Increase all faculty salary columns and steps to at least the median of the Bay 10 plus 1 effective July 1, 2013
2. Salary increase for all faculty of COLA and Growth or 3.6% whichever is higher.
	 
9.13     ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING (moved from 9.20)
	 
Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.
	 
9.14     Pay for Participation in PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT Days ACTIVITIES
	 
9.14.1. Adjunct faculty shall be paid for activities in which they participate, not to exceed three four (4) hours per PD day No adjunct faculty will be paid for both regularly scheduled service and a PD day activity which occur during the same hour.
	 
9.14.2 All adjunct faculty who participate in professional responsibilities including but not limited to: curriculum development, SLO/PSLO development, program review; hiring committees, standing committees, Academic Senate, FA, AFT 6157 shall be paid on the non-instructional salary schedule.
	 
9.18 SENIORITY REHIRE PREFERENCE
	 
9.18.1  Adjunct faculty may attain Seniority Rehire Preference (SRP) status at either 33% or 40% load
            Adjunct faculty  may be assigned a 33% or more load (not to exceed 67% pursuant to Education Code Section 87482.5) may be granted Seniority Rehire Preference (SRP). 
9.18.1.1 SRP status provides a qualified adjunct faculty member with seniority rehire
preference rights over other less senior adjunct faculty within the division. "Qualified"
shall be determined in accordance with section 9.18.2. SRP status does not confer any
rights not specifically identified within this Agreement.
	 
9.18.1.2 The District will strive to provide assignments equal to or greater than a 33%     load for adjunct faculty who attain SRP at 33%.  
	 
9.18.1.3 The District will strive to provide assignments equal to or greater than 40% load for adjunct who attains SRP at 40%. 
	 
9.18.1.4 SRP status does not guarantee a load (i.e. a load is not available, misconduct, performance problems) or provide tenure, permanent status or any employment rights greater than those provided under Education Code 87665.
	 
9.18.1.5 An adjunct faculty member who attained SRP at 33% shall achieve SRP at 40%, after an additional three consecutive semesters of working at a 40% or greater load. Adjunct faculty shall have their SRP load readjusted effective January 2010.
	 
9.22 MEDICAL BENEFITS        
9.22.1  A medical benefit package has been implemented August 2002.
	 
9.22.2  Medical benefits will be consistent with the definition stated in the California
Education Code, Section 87861 et sec., which defines health insurance benefits to
include medical benefits but not vision or dental benefits.
	 
9.22.3  The District will provide health benefits to adjunct faculty allowed under Ed. Code Sec. 87861 as follows:
	 
Adjunct faculty must work at least 40% cumulative equivalent of a
minimum full-time faculty assignment.
Faculty members will pay one-half (1/2) of the monthly premium.
The District will submit a claim through the State for 50% matching funds.
State reimbursement is precluded for adjunct faculty with health benefit
insurance from another employer. Therefore, adjunct faculty seeking to
qualify for health benefits must provide certification that no other coverage
exits.
Adjunct faculty who are eligible for health benefits shall have the option to add coverage for eligible dependents at the employee's cost.
	 
9.22.4  The District exposure will be limited to $50,000. The District will provide the above amount each year as backfill should the State not have enough money to fund the 50% match. 
If in a given year the $50,000 or a portion of it were not needed for backfill, this amount would be used to defray a portion of the faculty memberâs cost in the following year. Each year the District will spend a maximum of $50,000 for this program.
	 
If the backfill exceeds $50,000 in a given year, the District will pay it; however, the amount over $50,000 will be added as an additional adjunct faculty member premium in the following year.
9.27     SICK LEAVE Annual Entitlement, ADJUNCT Faculty
	 
Adjunct faculty shall be entitled, for each semester of service, to a pro-rata of five (5) days of sick leave based on their percentage of load. [See Article 13, Leaves and Absences]. Paychecks for adjunct faculty shall reflect the number of sick hours accrued.  See Articles 13.5.1.4 & 13.5.1.5 for further reference on sick leave entitlement for adjunct faculty. (In process of investigating Sick leave conversion for retirement-may need to open this section).
	 
NEW Section: Implementation of State Disability Insurance:
State Disability Insurance (SDI): Adjunct Faculty payroll deductions will be made to cover the cost of participation  in the SDI plan effective March 10, 2012. 
	 
ARTICLE 11 CALENDARS Article of Choice
Need calendar for 2015-2016
	 
11.5     PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT DAYS           
	 
Normally, four (4) days of the academic calendar year (two one (1) with mandatory attendance) are designated as Professional Development calendar days for the purposes of conducting activities to address critical staff, student, and professional development needs.
11.5.1  Two One Mandatory Day
One (1) Professional Development day each year (in March/April) shall be used for campus-wide convocation at which the president/vice president of the Faculty Association shall be invited to make a presentation.  An additional day, the first PD day in the fall shall be used for activities which may include: campus-wide planning to meet student needs; divisional planning and activities coordinated by the Division Dean; department meetings and activities at which the president/vice president of the Faculty Association shall be invited to make a presentation.  Attendance at the these meetings March/April Campus wide convocation shall be mandatory for all instructional and non-instructional staff.
	 
ARTICLE 12 WORKLOAD, CLASS SIZE, CLASS CANCELLATION âarticle of Choice
	 
12.3.1 Instructional
12.3.1.2 Laboratory Class Assignment.  Twenty (20) in-class academic hours of laboratory per week is a 1.00 FTEF assignment.  Each laboratory class per week is 1/20 or 5% of 1.00 FTEF assignment. Each science laboratory class per week is 1/15 or 6 2/3% of 1.00 FTEF assignment.
	 
12.8     CLASS CANCELLATION
No class shall be canceled if it has a minimum of 20 registered students. Whenever possible, Scheduled classes shall be canceled only after consultation with the instructor.  Classes may be canceled with the consent of the instructor at any time.
	           
12.8.1  Without the Consent of the Instructor
	 
12.8.1.1     A class may be canceled within thirty (30) five (5) days before the class starts if the enrollment is less than 60% of the class maximum;
12.8.1.2     During the first two weeks of instruction, a class may be canceled if enrollment is less than 80% of the class maximum;
12.8.1.3     Classes shall not be canceled after the second week of instruction without the consent of the instructor.
	 
ARTICLE 17 BENEFITS
The District shall continue to pay the full cost of any increases in all health and welfare benefits. There will be no monetary Cap on medical benefits listed in the contract to have ensure comparable benefits with the other bargaining unit.- Delete Dollar Amounts
	 
	 
ARTICLE 18 RETIREMENT
The District shall continue to pay the full cost of any increases in all health benefits for retirees. There will be no monetary Cap on medical benefits listed in the contract to ensure comparable benefits with the other bargaining unit.  Delete Dollar Amount
